summary: Portfolio/marketing SPA for Imran Zahoor built with React/TanStack Router/Tailwind/shadcn-style components, shifting primary CTA from external scheduling links to a persistent WhatsApp chat CTA and making the About page the default landing route; updates requested to About-page hero copy/heading and overall mobile responsiveness, to be delivered in draft mode for review before publishing.

existing_features.title: SPA routing with shared layout (header/nav, mobile menu, footer)
existing_features.description: Implements a multi-page single-page application using TanStack Router with a root Layout component that provides sticky navigation (desktop + mobile menu), route-based active styling, and a footer with quick links, consultation CTA, and LinkedIn link.

existing_features.title: Home page marketing hero with rotating taglines and CTAs
existing_features.description: Home page includes a timed rotating headline/tagline, credibility/metrics bar, expertise highlight cards, and call-to-action buttons linking to case studies and an external Google Calendar booking page.

existing_features.title: Services catalog page
existing_features.description: Displays a curated set of BI/analytics service offerings with structured sections for problems solved, deliverables, and outcomes, presented in card-based UI with icons and a CTA to contact/booking.

existing_features.title: Executive Impact Summary page
existing_features.description: Presents multiple impact sections (architecture/governance, dashboards, optimization, automation, enablement) with quantified metrics and an organizational benefits summary, ending with a consultation booking CTA.

existing_features.title: About page with profile, education, and competencies
existing_features.description: Shows a professional profile image, location, narrative bio, education history, “known for” highlights, and a badge list of core competencies.

existing_features.title: Case studies listing with tabbed deep dives
existing_features.description: Renders multiple case studies as cards with images and category badges. Each includes a tabbed interface (context, approach, tools, outcomes) and uses iconography for scannable storytelling.

existing_features.title: Certifications and technical stack showcase
existing_features.description: Lists professional certifications and organizes a technical stack by category with badges and icon-led cards, plus a summary competency/experience panel.

existing_features.title: Contact form submission via FormSubmit.co (backendless)
existing_features.description: Implements a client-side contact form with required field checks, basic email validation, loading/submitted/error UI states, and toast notifications. Submits JSON payloads to FormSubmit.co’s AJAX endpoint without requiring a custom backend.

existing_features.title: CV download from static assets
existing_features.description: Provides a client-side download action that programmatically creates an anchor element and triggers download of a bundled PDF resume from the public/static assets directory, with toast feedback.

existing_features.title: External consultation booking integration
existing_features.description: Integrates an external Google Calendar scheduling URL across multiple pages (header CTA, home CTAs, impact CTA, contact booking card), opening in a new tab with appropriate rel attributes.

existing_features.title: Theming and design system (Tailwind + CSS tokens + dark mode)
existing_features.description: Uses TailwindCSS with extended theme configuration and CSS variable color tokens (OKLCH) for a consistent enterprise visual identity. Dark mode is supported through next-themes with class-based switching.

existing_features.title: Toast notification system
existing_features.description: Uses Sonner’s Toaster to display success/error notifications for key UX flows (e.g., form validation/submission, download initiation).

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication context (ICP)
existing_features.description: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider that initializes AuthClient, loads a persisted identity on mount, and exposes login/logout/identity state with status flags and error handling.

existing_features.title: Canister actor creation and caching (ICP)
existing_features.description: Implements a useActor hook that creates an authenticated or anonymous ICP canister actor depending on the current identity and caches it via react-query. On actor changes, it invalidates/refetches non-actor queries to keep dependent data consistent.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister: blob storage management mixin
existing_features.description: Backend canister includes a storage mixin providing authorization management (gateway principals), dead blob enumeration and confirmation-based pruning, a forced GC trigger, and a cashier cycle refill/top-up mechanism guarded by an environment-configured principal.

existing_features.title: Motoko HTTP outcalls utility module
existing_features.description: Provides reusable GET/POST HTTP outcall helpers with optional transform function, cycle budgeting, default headers (User-Agent and Idempotency-Key for POST), and UTF-8 decoding with traps on empty responses.

existing_features.title: Backend readiness placeholder hook
existing_features.description: Exposes a minimal hook that reports readiness based on actor availability and fetching state, serving as a placeholder for future backend-dependent queries/features.

architectural_notes: Frontend is a React SPA using TanStack Router with a shared Layout (sticky header/nav + footer) and page-per-route structure.
UI styling uses TailwindCSS with CSS-variable-driven OKLCH color tokens and dark mode via next-themes (class-based).
State/data utilities include @tanstack/react-query for caching and lifecycle management (notably for ICP actor creation).
Notifications use Sonner toast system for client-side UX feedback (form validation/submission, downloads).
ICP integration pattern: InternetIdentityProvider (AuthClient) provides an Identity; useActor creates an authenticated or anonymous canister actor depending on identity.
Backend is Motoko and assembled via mixins (include MixinStorage()), indicating a compositional canister architecture.
Backend blob storage management relies on low-level Prim APIs (e.g., dead blob enumeration/pruning, GC trigger), implying ICP platform-specific storage/GC workflows.
External integrations are intentionally backendless for key UX flows (FormSubmit.co for contact email forwarding; static assets for CV and favicons; external Google Calendar booking).
Primary site CTA is a persistent cross-page WhatsApp chat entry point; external scheduling/booking CTAs are removed/replaced.
Changes should be delivered as a draft/review build and not promoted to production until explicit approval.
known_issues: React Query is initialized twice with two different QueryClient instances (in src/main.tsx and src/App.tsx), which can cause cache/provider confusion and duplicated network/query behavior.
frontend/src/pages/ExperiencePage.tsx is empty in the provided code, while repo summaries imply an implemented experience timeline; routing for an Experience page is also absent in App.tsx.

frontend/src/components/FaviconLoader.tsx is empty in the provided code, while repo summaries describe a backend-driven favicon loader; favicon handling appears to have shifted to static links in index.html.

Two different CSS files appear to exist with overlapping naming (frontend/src/index.css and frontend/index.css) and conflicting token sets; this can lead to inconsistent theming depending on what is actually imported/built.
Contact form posts directly to FormSubmit.co with a hard-coded recipient email; this may increase spam exposure and is not configurable via environment variables.
Client-side contact form only uses basic validation and disables captcha via _captcha=false; no honeypot/rate limiting is implemented.
CV download path contains spaces ('/assets/Resume - Imran Zahoor.pdf'); depending on hosting/static pipeline, URL encoding and caching headers may cause download issues.
Backend storage authorization list depends on an explicit update call (_caffeineStorageUpdateGatewayPrincipals); if not invoked, authorizedPrincipals remains empty and admin operations will trap.
Backend depends on CAFFFEINE_STORAGE_CASHIER_PRINCIPAL env var (note spelling); missing/misnamed env configuration will cause runtime traps when refill/update functions are called.

Process risk/regression: assistant messages indicate the site was taken live in production despite the requirement to remain in draft mode until explicit user approval; ensure no production deploy occurs until approved.
